descript.abstract: Acoustic Data Library (ADL) for the broadband split-beam fish tracker. Acoustic data has been collected from over 15 locations worldwide. With over 100 weeks of trials in oceans, lakes, rivers, and pools SciFish 2000 has successfully collected data for over 20 different species including Pacific herring, Lake sturgeon, paddlefish, Chinook and Sockeye salmon, Alaskan walleye pollock, jellyfish, krill, Pacific halibut, alewife, smelt, Pacific Cod, and Pacific Ocean Perch. The ADL consists of documentation, data and databases that serves as a repository for broadband acoustic data, its associated parameters, and collection conditions.
descript.purpose: To provide acoustic data of fish species.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
